title: mapping the crossroads
body:
mapping the crossroads chapter 3 is up!

“They keep moving.

Fjord tries to ignore what he’s seen. It doesn’t matter now, they’ve got more pressing issues at hand than that, than Fjord’s feelings. “

Thank you very much reading! <3

blog.title: Green Day=Nickelback, said Sam Riegel
blog.description: Main personal blog @pencilwarrior01. 18+ content. Just a blog for a decent Critical Role fan who needs to catch up and not clog her main blog. Name's Lulu, Luisa, or Alex, whichever you prefer. 27, she/her, bi, my art tag is #luludoesart, and Ko-fi is https://ko-fi.com/A0085KN. Icon by @alice-quinn

body:
My prediction for next time.

Yeza: “You’re the mysterious voice I’ve heard in my head.”

Jester: “Yes! That’s me, Jester! You’re free to come with us now-”

Yeza: “Wait, just like that? But what about the guards?”

Jester: “So, technicallyyy, we’re heroes of Xhorhas and they’re, like, totally grateful to us and said, "You all totes can have anything you want, it’s cool!”

Yeza: “…”

Jester: “And the goblin is actually your wife! She’s super alive, and she’s my detective partner, and she knows magic! Well, not my special-special magic from my buddy The Traveler-OH, you’ve ever heard of The Traveler? He’s SO cool-”

Yeza: *Is processing that his wife is what now?*

blog.name: acepalindrome
blog.title: you're going to be something extraordinary
blog.description: Hello, this is Palindrome! I'm currently doing my best to pretend that I'm a functional and well adjusted adult, with varying levels of success! Around this neck of the woods you'll find history stuff, nature stuff, whatever fandoms I'm into at the moment, fanfics I write when I can muster up the energy, the occasional mental breakdown and a variety of fun facts I come across or things I find interesting. Feel free to follow or drop me a line, I promise I'm quite tame.

tags: i’ve seen some stuff saying she might feel burned by this
but it’s not like she’s going to be exiled from the cobalt soul
but she can always go elsewhere
she may not want to but it’s an option
summary: i think it’s important to note that beau’s ties are less to the empire and more to the cobalt soul, which is an international...
body: i think it’s important to note that beau’s ties are less to the empire and more to the cobalt soul, which is an international organization with branches (that we know of) in vasselheim and emon. at most, she might feel tied to dairon, but she didn’t show fondness for anyone else there.

reblog.comment: i think it’s important to note that beau’s ties are less to the empire and more to the cobalt soul, which is an international organization with branches (that we know of) in vasselheim and emon. at most, she might feel tied to dairon, but she didn’t show fondness for anyone else there.

trail.content_raw: i think it’s important to note that beau’s ties are less to the empire and more to the cobalt soul, which is an international organization with branches (that we know of) in vasselheim and emon. at most, she might feel tied to dairon, but she didn’t show fondness for anyone else there.
trail.content: i think it’s important to note that beau’s ties are less to the empire and more to the cobalt soul, which is an international organization with branches (that we know of) in vasselheim and emon. at most, she might feel tied to dairon, but she didn’t show fondness for anyone else there.

tags: he has the most dynamic character arc so far
and 90% of the Big Damn Moments of the M9 arc are because of him
summary: Me: The beauty of D&D - the thing that ensures it’ll never be replaced by digital surrogates - is the fact that the very game...
body:
Me: The beauty of D&D - the thing that ensures it’ll never be replaced by digital surrogates - is the fact that the very game itself is a community creative effort. No one person is more responsible for the events that unfold in the game’s universe than any other person. There’s no one protagonist, no one story, no one character arc. Everyone who plays is vital to the continuation of the game


Also me: Caleb Widogast is the protagonist of the Mighty Nein arc you can’t change my mind

reblog.comment:

No one person is more responsible for the events that unfold in the game’s universe than any other person. There’s no one protagonist, no one story, no one character arc. Everyone who plays is vital to the continuation of the game


Also me: Caleb Widogast is the protagonist of the Mighty Nein arc you can’t change my mind

No one person is more responsible for the events that unfold in the game’s universe than any other person. There’s no one protagonist, no one story, no one character arc. Everyone who plays is vital to the continuation of the game


Also me: Caleb Widogast is the protagonist of the Mighty Nein arc you can’t change my mind

tags: he can try and argue it was selfish and he was ONLY thinking of himself
he can try and i will FIGHT HIM
i feel a meta coming on
summary: So, uh, we gonna talk about the fact that Caleb ‘I am just using you all’ Widogast was the one to surrender the beacon to save...
body:
So, uh, we gonna talk about the fact that Caleb ‘I am just using you all’ Widogast was the one to surrender the beacon to save them? 

That Caleb, who wants to turn back time, to alter fate and undo his mistakes, the /very/ thing this beacon allows a person to do, gave it up to save his new friends? 

That he gave up the chance to study it, and learn from it, and exploit all the possibility it might have given him to do everything he wants to do to save his friends?

That he gave up the chance to study it, and learn from it, and exploit all the possibility it might have given him to do everything he wants to do to save his friends?

summary: So far favorite moment of watching critical role, campaign 2, ep 5- Beau (after licking Molly’s hand and turning to Fjord): You...
body:
So far favorite moment of watching critical role, campaign 2, ep 5-

Beau (after licking Molly’s hand and turning to Fjord): You taste like a seamen.

DM: ……… (very small voice after double face palming) I have never been more proud of my wife.

summary: So we all agree that Caleb giving away the dodecahedron wasn’t random, right? This was a temptation test for Caleb and he failed...
body:
So we all agree that Caleb giving away the dodecahedron wasn’t random, right? This was a temptation test for Caleb and he failed spectacularly (regardless of any kind of moral goodness that may come to light as we get to know the Krynn’s side of the war). While there’s the obvious “I don’t want to die” angle going on here, we can’t ignore how Caleb’s walked right into the greatest wealth of knowledge that will lead him to his primary character goal: the control of time and fate. The Krynn, as far as he understands, has this power. Think about what things he would be able to “fix” if he had that kind of power at his disposal.

  • Nott can be turned back into a halfling
  • Molly can be resurrected
  • He can bring his family back or prevent them from dying in the first place
  • Trent, and the Empire in general, can pay for what they did to him

Unless they can convince him otherwise, we’re looking at Caleb’s villain origin story.

summary:
LBM 2019 - Saturday (Post 2/5)
All the wonderful critters!!
body:
LBM 2019 - Saturday (Post 2/5)

All the wonderful critters!! <3<3<3 Honestly, I was so excited to see so many wonderful cosplayers this year! Super excited also that the combined Vox Machina/ Mighty Nein group lined up for a big group photo like seriously… I’m dead.

It you know anyone in these pics or see yourself, let me know if I can find you on Tumblr or Instagram!! There’s so much talent in these photos/cosplays!
